CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 2, 1945, pg. 1 reads: "This Causes Floods-...hokey pile deposited on an empty lot at the corner of Enoch and Devilliers Streets is shown overflowing into a sewer drop. Clogged sewers fail to take the heavy rains, and drive sand, dirt, mud and debris into the lowlands and central streets of the Hill District.  Centre Avenue, Wylie Avenue, and Fifth Avenue witnessed such an occurrence during Monday's rainstorm. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Empty lot with large pile of debris, corner of Enoch and Devilliers Streets, Hill District
